result.title: Summer — Session #6 — Strongly Connected Components, Articulation Points and Bridges
result.content:
AlSalam Allaikum All,

This session we have discussed various graph algorithms, this included:

  • Kosaraju's Strongly Connected Components

  • Tarjan's Strongly Connected Components

  • Articulation Points and Bridges

The following resources cover the discussed topics with pseudo code, kindly refer to them:

  • Tarjan's Algorithm on Wikipedia

  • Kosaraju's Algorithm on Wikipedia

  • Articulation Points on Wikipedia

  • Pages 62 to 66 in Competitive Programming 1, refer to the book here

You will have some time to read the above sections before we post the session's problem, kindly read and make sure you understand them. Don't hesitate to ask questions.

[Update] For this session's problems, we will be using a2oj.com, you will need to register for an account. A2oj is a platform that enables users to create contests with problems existing on other various sources.

To solve a problem you will need to submit the solution to the native problem source (UVa, SPOJ or Codeforces) and a2oj will link your submission automatically using your usernames.

Make sure you have accounts on UVa and SPOJ. You will also need to link your Codeforces, UVa and SPOJ accounts with your a2oj account.

Here is the contest link https://a2oj.com/register?ID=26675, register and start solving when the contest starts.
